result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Edwin William Sunderland

defendant.name: Sunderland, Patrick Edwin William
defendant.address: 2052 County Rd S, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

8:48 AM Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland in court, in custody.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Patrick Edwin William Sunderland.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to ct. 2 & 6.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of ct. 2 & 6. Counts 1 dismissed outright. Counts 3-5 dismissed but read in for sentencing. Defense requests PSI. Court orders PSI.  Bond remains in effect.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:45 PM Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Aaron Schenk appeared by video for Patrick Edwin William Sunderland.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Viel indicates offer from state, requesting time to look at it.  Court schedules plea/sentencing.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Patrick Edwin William Sunderland. Court questions where matter is at. Atty Viel requests theses cases follow defendants two cases with atty Shenck for possible global resolution  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 10:40 am.

4:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Patrick Edwin William Sunderland. Atty Viel requests case gets scheduled with other cases. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Court removes pretrial release monitoring  - Alcohol monitoring.  All other conditions remain as previously set.

Court addresses request for bond modification. Defense requests the Pretrial release monitoring - Alcohol monitoring be removed. State has no objection. Court grants request, removes alcohol monitoring.

1:30PM Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court inquires if Atty Schenk will represent defendant on this case also.  Atty Schenk indicates he will.  Defense waives formal reading of complaint, enters not guilty plea.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 02:50 pm.

3:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland appeared in court. Atty Schenk indicates defendant has not retained him for this case yet.  Defendant indicates wants to speak with Atty Schenk.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
CIB records request.   (Complaint and bond emailed to CIB 1/27/22 at 8:32 am)
Cash Bond posted by Korissa Sperber.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - High- Level

1:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Patrick Edwin William Sunderland appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Attorney Shannon Viel appeared by video. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Atty Viel indicates defendant does qualify for SPD. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
